# First Try

This is one way to cite [@Son2022].

Another way to cite would be @Son2023.

# code chunk

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| label: fig-firstfig
#| warning: false
#| fig-cap: Example Fig
#| fig-cap-location: top
#| cache: false


library(dplyr)
library(WDI)
library(ggplot2)

var = c('GDPpc' = 'NY.GDP.PCAP.KD')
wdi <- WDI(indicator=var,
           start=1970,
           country = 'all',
           end=2020,
           extra=TRUE)   %>%
  filter(region !="Aggregates") %>%
  filter(!is.na(GDPpc))

wdi %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=year, y=GDPpc)) +
  geom_point(alpoha=0.1,
             size=0.1) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.text = element_text(size=0))

```


See @fig-firstfig
